attributes.action: Amend the Hunting Act 2004 to include a ban on riding out with hunting hounds.
attributes.additional_details:
This article by Stuart Radbpurne clearly demonstrates how hunt clubs continue to break the law:-
http://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/earth/countryside/12070105/Fox-hunting-is-the-greatest-sport-on-Gods-green-earth.html

Foxes are being caught, held captive and then released for the pleasure of hunt members:-
http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-england-leicestershire-35173342

An article on the barbaric manner in which the hounds are dealt:-
http://www.nwhsa.org.uk/hypocrites.html
attributes.background: The Act is deficient in that it allows hunt clubs to ride out with hounds. Hounds do not abide by the law. They pick up the scent of a fox, they chase. The law continues to be flouted in the UK and foxes are still being killed. If hunt clubs aren't hunting, there's no requirement for hunt hounds.
